byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul, and Niki Kitsantonis from Athens.
byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CEYLAN YEGINSU

abstract: Failed coup against Turkish Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan raises questions over country's future direction; leader's increasingly autocratic conduct indicates he may forgo efforts to unite his Islamist supporters and country's secular liberals, both of whom opposed coup.
lead_paragraph: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s victory over the uprising may have bolstered his popularity among Islamists, but wider support was not yet certain.

headline.main: Erdogan Triumphs After Coup Attempt, but Turkey’s Fate Is Unclear
headline.print_headline: Erdogan Triumphs, but Turkey’s Fate Is Unclear

snippet: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s victory over the uprising may have bolstered his popularity among Islamists, but wider support was not yet certain....

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
